4.text: These people are amongst the greatest quiz players in Britain.

- I don't recall Hubble or Tombaugh

1621.text:
- ever having been noted for... 
- Novel writing.

1627.text: Whereas Carl Sagan did occasionally turn his hand to fiction.

1631.text:
- Yeah, OK. 
- So, go with that, yeah?

1635.text: Not 100% certain, but we think the one there

1637.text: who occasionally turned his hand to fiction,

1643.text: So, we had a Jodie Kidd on this side

1645.text: and we had a Jodie Foster on that side.

1647.text: It's been pretty evenly matched, this amazing contest. Is it over?

1651.text: The novel entitled Contact was indeed written by Carl Sagan.

1655.text: We say congratulations, Eggheads. You have won.

1663.text: Yeah, you started awkwardly, and then really powered through them

1667.text: and they just held you off at the end there.

1670.text:
- Yeah. 
- Oh, Jodie Kidd. Don't ever look at a photo of her.

1674.text:
- We didn't know it, so I don't think we can really... 
- No complaints.

1677.text:
- Difficult to guess from nothing, yeah. 
- Yeah.

1680.text: Thank you so much for playing.

1681.text: Commiserations as well to Quizee McRascal.

1685.text: The Eggheads have done what is coming

1686.text: increasingly naturally to them, but I won't use the word effortless.

1690.text:
- Certainly not today. 
- No, not at all. 
- The winning streak continues.

1693.text: It does mean you won't be going home with the £23,000,

1696.text: so the money now rolls over to our next show.

1699.text: Join us next time to see if a new team of Challengers

1702.text: can win the money and defeat them.

1704.text: £24,000 says they can't. Till then, goodbye.
